findings.LOWER_CHEST: Bibasilar atelectasis. No large pleural effusion or pericardial effusion. Coronary artery calcifications are moderate.

ABDOMEN.HEPATOBILIARY: The liver demonstrates homogenous attenuation with no evidence of focal lesions or biliary dilatation. The gallbladder is surgically absent.

PANCREAS.size_change: Hypodense cystic lesion in the proximal pancreatic body increased from 0.6 x 0.7 cm to 1.1 x 1.5 cm.
PANCREAS.associated_finding: Soft tissue stranding about the pancreatic head and body. No pancreatic ductal dilatation.

SPLEEN.change: Subtle peripheral hypodensity likely reflects a prior infarct, new from the prior exam.

ADRENALS.left_adrenal: 1.3 x 1.3 cm nodule unchanged compared to prior exam, previously characterized as an adrenal adenoma.

ABDOMEN.URINARY: Mild right renal cortical scarring; multiple bilateral renal cystic structures measuring up to 2.6 x 2.4 cm in the right upper pole kidney. No evidence of focal renal lesions or hydronephrosis.
ABDOMEN.GASTROINTESTINAL: Unremarkable stomach; small bowel loops normal; colon and rectum normal; appendix not visualized, no signs of appendicitis.
ABDOMEN.PELVIS: Urinary bladder and distal ureters unremarkable; no free fluid.
ABDOMEN.VASULAR: No abdominal aortic aneurysm; extensive atherosclerotic disease.
ABDOMEN.SOFT_TISSUES: Abdominal and pelvic wall within normal limits.

changes_over_time.SPLEEN: Peripheral hypodensity is new from prior exam.
